intro: Chamaesyce quitensis, commonly known as the Andean groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually small, hairy, and arranged in a rosette pattern, which helps reduce water loss. Chamaesyce quitensis produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators.
